instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> no camera
threads.message:
hi, Im seeing a few post saying to live with camera because it's too risky right ?
as an iphone technician who have tried repair ip6+ touch issue, ip 7 audio issue, i think <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> should be easier compared to that right ? or not ?correct me if im wrong.
well anyway does anyone have a stencil for this chip

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> no camera
threads.message:
Copy & paste from dukefawks:
"I ball them with universal stencil
0.3mm balls
but need to replace the chip, they are often just dead
BCM15700"
